message_1: In how many ways can a committee of 3 members be formed from a group of 7 people? (Assume that all members of the group are eligible to be on the committee.)
message_2:
To form a committee of 3 members from a group of 7 people, we can use the combination formula. The combination formula is given by:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people, k is the number of people to be chosen, and ! denotes the factorial.

In this case, n = 7 and k = 3. So, the formula becomes:

C(7, 3) = 7! / (3!(7-3)!)

C(7, 3) = 7! / (3!4!)

C(7, 3) = (7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(7, 3) = (7 × 6 × 5) / (3 × 2 × 1)

C(7, 3) = 210 / 6

C(7, 3) = 35

So, there are 35 ways to form a committee of 3 members from a group of 7 people.
